citation.name: Structure
citation.title: The Phe105 loop of Alix Bro1 domain plays a key role in HIV-1 release.

comment.text: Plays a role in sorting of endocytic ubiquitinated cargos into multivesicular bodies (MVBs) via its interaction with the ESCRT-I complex (endosomal sorting complex required for transport I), and possibly also other ESCRT complexes. May act as a negative regulator of Ras-mediated mitogenic activity. Plays a role in ciliogenesis.
Protein tyrosine phosphate + H(2)O = protein tyrosine + phosphate.
Interacts with GRAP2 and GRB2. Interacts with UBAP1 and CHMP4B.
Belongs to the protein-tyrosine phosphatase family. Non-receptor class subfamily.

property.value: P:early endosome to late endosome transport
P:negative regulation of epithelial cell migration
P:positive regulation of adherens junction organization
P:positive regulation of early endosome to late endosome transport
P:positive regulation of homophilic cell adhesion
P:positive regulation of Wnt protein secretion
P:ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process via the multivesicular body sorting pathway

feature.description: 6 X 2 AA approximate tandem repeats of P-Q
In a lung cancer cell line; may be a common polymorphism; dbSNP:rs149563514.
Nearly abolishes interaction with CHMP4B. Abolishes interaction with CHMP4B; when associated with D-206.
Abolishes interaction with CHMP4B; when associated with D-202.
